value.0: <StartAction>[Imperial Officer Ganolin gazes up at you weakly as you approach, his face bloodied and broken.]</Start> <Sir/Madam>... <FirstName>... is... is that you?

<StartAction>[It seems Officer Ganolin is about to say more, but suddenly, his eyes roll upwards into his head, and his breath grows still... It seems you will now have to find your way to the Docks on your own...]</Start>

<StartAction>[Ganolin smiles weakly.]</Start> It... it is good to see you alive... <FirstName>... Word... word reached me of your father's... death... and... and I had little hope that you would... survive...
I... I tried... tried to keep the gates... to... to the Docks open... <FirstName>... but... but it seems... the enemy has finally... bested me...
<FirstName>... you must get to the Docks... quickly... Enemy ships have been... sighted on the... horizon... There... there isn't much... much time to make an escape... so... so you must hurry!
I... I am not... long... for this world... <FirstName>... but... but I will help... help you if I can...
Gods speed to you... <Sir/Madam>... <FirstName>... May Rakha... keep you in His... hands...
Look... look around you, <FirstName>... This... this city... is doomed... We... we cannot... fight so many... we... we are too... weak now...
Escape... escape to the Docks... while there is still time... If... if the enemy takes the Docks... there... there will be no way out... of this death trap...

<StartAction>[Ganolin's eyes become hard as steel for a moment, fear glinting from within them.]</Start> Yes... yes... Dear gods, he... he and his followers... passed... into the Docks just... a while ago...
My men... and I tried... tried to fight them back... but... but we were stricken... in fear... and... and... we could not hold them off...
You... you could try... try to find a boat here on the river bank... But... but most have already... already been taken by others... so... so I do not know if you will find one... available...
I... I have heard... that Mikel... Ravenclaw... scoundrel that he is... once had a passage to... to the Docks erected below his... lair.
But... but Ravenclaw Tavern... was... destroyed... early in the battle... so... I... don't know how... much of his lair... remains...

<StartAction>[Ganolin gazes weakly towards the wreckage on the bridge.]</Start> You... you may be able... able to clear a path... through that debris... <FirstName>... But... but be wary of the enemy... for they are many...
Quick, <FirstName>! Escape to the Docks before it is too late!
<< Set owner's journal quest to "JT_ST_1_MAIN" >>
<< Activates "N_TALK_SWITCH" if "N_MODULE_STAGE" is 1. >>

<StartAction>[Ganolin, Imperial Officer of the Market District, salutes at your approach.]</Start> Greetings to you, <Sir/Madam> <FullName>. I hope you are enjoying your stay in the Market District, and keeping clear of trouble.
What can I do for you this <quarterday>?
As you wish, <Sir/Madam> <FirstName>. If you need anything, just let me know.
<StartAction>[Sigh.]</Start> It's a rough place at times, that's for sure. Ghaarak isn't as civilized as the Imperial cities to the south, and we have had our fair share of troubles of late.

To make matters more frustrating, Captain Anagril has given me a rather small number of men to police the market, and I constantly find we are far too undermanned to prove effective at maintaining peace.

Still, if you keep yourself out of trouble, this district has quite a lot to offer. There are quite a few merchant shops to peruse, and you should be able to find just about anything you could want here.

<StartAction>[Ganolin's slim face grows concerned.]</Start> I'm not sure what to think of it, but I'm worried little good will come of this. I just hope this doesn't add further troubles to my duties...
<StartAction>[Officer Ganolin bends down to inspect the body, removing the dagger from its back and looking it over carefully.]</Start> Well, now, this does seem quite incriminating...

I always had a feeling that Nelgir was a bit shady, but this... this is far more than I would have ever expected from him... I shall dispatch a group of guards to arrest the merchant immediately, <FirstName>.
You've done the city of Ghaarak a great service today, <FirstName>. I'm sure your father would be proud of your actions...

As a small reward for your service, which has saved my men and I quite a great deal of time, I would like to present you with this small purse of gold. Take it with the thanks of the city, <FirstName>...

It is the least I could do, <FirstName>. I only wish it could be more... My men shall see to Nelgir's arrest at once, and you may go knowing you have done far more than your part in bringing this criminal to justice...
<< Set owner's journal quest to "JT_PREL_KARA" >>

Well, now, that is quite a claim, <FirstName>... and one I can do little about without some solid proof. If you can discover something substantial to support your claim, return to me. Otherwise, I'm afraid there is little I can do...

I wish I could do more to aid you, but my garrison is limited at the moment, and I cannot spare any men for an investigation such as this. I'm afraid you're going to have to be on your own for this one, <lad/lass>...

<StartAction>[Officer Ganolin appears quite embarrassed.]</Start> I will be the first to admit that my small garrison is not the most ideal peace keeping force for the Market, but please believe me when I say we do our best...
If you can uncover some solid evidence, perhaps then I can lend the men to aid you, but until that time, I'm afraid I just can't do anything more... Good luck to you anyway, <lad/lass>...
Good luck to you, and please do return to me if you can discover anything of importance, as I shall be sure to look into it immediately.

Well, if I had to take a guess, I'd say that sounds quite a bit like the sewers here in the city... You might want to talk to Egbar the Dwarf down below the city. He's the only person who knows much about those sewers...
<< Set owner's journal quest to "JT_PREL_KARA" >>
This is disturbing news indeed, <FirstName>. If Chancellor Varhun has betrayed the Empire... times have grown dark for Ghaarak. Strange prophets, betrayals, and now this...

I will send my men to keep an eye on Ravenclaw Tavern. I'm not sure what to suggest regarding Chancellor Varhun. He is a high ranking official, and may prove a bit more troubling. There is little I can do against him, I'm afraid.

Er... yes, well, I have a lot to manage <FirstName>. I will send my men to look after Ravenclaw Tavern. You focus on stopping Chancellor Varhun. Good luck in your efforts, and I hope no harm comes of this...
Good luck, <FirstName>. I hope you can stop the Chancellor's plans before any harm comes to Magistrate Okaris. It would be a terrible tragedy if anything were to happen to him...
<< Set owner's journal quest to "JT_PREL_MARK" >>

This is a serious accusation, <FirstName>, as a plot against an Imperial Magistrate carries the penalty of death upon it. Mikel Ravenclaw is an influential member of this district, and carries a great deal of power here.

I will need proof of Mikel's involvement in such a plot if I am to act against him. Unfortunately, I do not have the soldiers available to mount such an investigation on my own, so I'm afraid it will fall on you to find any evidence.
Do not blaspheme against the Emperor, child! Your father would be shocked to hear it. Go find your evidence against Mikel and maybe there'll be soldiers to spare then...

<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> I'm truly sorry, <FirstName>, but I cannot afford to spare my men right now. I wish there was more I could do, but you will have to be on your own for this investigation.

<StartAction>[Success]</Start> I suppose I can send two of my guards to assist you. I will have them meet you at the Ravenclaw tavern. I wish I could do more, but I truly can't spare any more men right now.
<< Set owner's journal quest to "JT_PREL_MARK" >>
<< Set owner's journal quest to "JT_PREL_MARK" >>
Are you okay? The Market District is no place for a young noble<man/woman>, <Master/Mistress> <FirstName>. I'd sleep a lot better tonight if I knew you were safe and sound in the Imperial District.
<< Activates "N_TALK_SWITCH" if "N_MODULE_STAGE" is 0. >>
<< This conversation node does nothing but reset the variable "N_TALK_SWITCH" >>
<< Set owner's journal quest to "JT_PRELUDE" >>
<StartAction>[Leave Ganolin to his fate.]</Start>
Yes, Officer Ganolin... it is I...
Farewell, Officer Ganolin. May the gods keep you.
Is there nothing that will save Ghaarak?
Have you seen the Crimson Prophet?
Is there any other way to the Docks?
The bridge gate to the Docks is destroyed.
I'll keep that in mind..
Farewell, Ganolin.
Can you tell me a bit about the Market District?
I see. Thanks for the information.
What do you make of that strange prophet's appearance?
<< Set owner's journal quest to "JT_PRELUDE" >>
Merchant Nelgir murdered his father. I have evidence.
Thank you, Officer.
Nelgir the gem merchant had his father murdered...
No wonder crime is so rampant...
Well, you're certainly of little use...
Very well. I'll see what I can find on my own.
Know anywhere "dark, and with a terrible stench?"
<< Set owner's journal quest to "JT_PREL_KARA" >>
Varhun is paying Ravenclaw to assassinate my father and I.
Yes, you do seem quite useless...
Leave the Chancellor to me.
Mikel Ravenclaw is plotting against my father.
The Emperor's a fool if even his men won't help.
Very well...
I understand, Officer. I'll be fine on my own.
<StartAction>[Persuade]</Start> Surely there are a few you can spare.
That'll do fine. Thank you, Officer Ganolin.
An attempt has been made on my life!
<< Set owner's journal quest to "JT_PREL_MARK" >>
